frame.name: Obligation_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>Under some, usually implicit, <fen>Condition</fen> a <fen>Duty</fen> needs to be fulfilled by a <fen>Responsible_party</fen>. If the <fen>Duty</fen> is not performed, there may be some undesirable social <fen>Consequence</fen> for the <fen>Responsible_party</fen>. This <fen>Consequence</fen> may or may not be stated overtly. </def-root>

FE.name: Duty
FE.definition: <def-root>The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform. </def-root>

FE.name: Condition
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Condition</fen>s under which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Consequence
FE.definition: <def-root>The undesirable <fen>Consequence</fen> that will result if the <fen>Duty</fen> is not performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to fulfill the <fen>Duty</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
<ex>I almost forgot to tell you that <fex name="pla">in Sweden</fex> we are <t>obligated</t> to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The deviation of the requirement from the norm.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The desirable situation which can be brought about by fulfilling the <fen>Duty</fen>.</def-root>
